value.title: DAX fridays! #19: DIVIDE
value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX! value.title: DAX Fridays! #34: UNICHAR and REPT
value.excerpt: In today’s video I will show you  two new DAX functions: UNICHAR and REPT  UNICHAR DAX function allows you to display unicode symbols in Power BI and Excel.   REPT allows you to repeat text using DAX.  With both functions you can create a star rating visualization among other cool things.  Chris Web

value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.   For example, if you want to calculate the sum of sales between two specific dates, this is the perfect function for you.  You can "hardcode" the

value.title: DAX Fridays! #82: How to learn DAX for beginners
value.excerpt: So you want to know which path to take to learn DAX and you want to use my DAX Fridays! videos? No problem, in this video, I have put together a list of the order you could follow to learn DAX based on the function difficulties, the common needs on the report and your previous experience.
